name: Arabesque
description:
Description

Base 

  • Lean back with straight arms (this allows the flyer to lean forward and come into the counterbalance).
  • Do not grip close to the knee but higher as this may be hurtful.

Flyer 

  • Foot is parallel to the thigh of the base.
  • Lean forward.

Spotter 

  • Be close to the hips of the flyer.
contactPoint: Flyer on the knees of base

name: Sitting on Feet (L-Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Point the feet slightly to offer a nice platform.

Flyer 

  • Place your feet on the backside of the legs of the base (this will support your weight).

Spotter 

  • Spot the hips of the flyer.

name: Shoulderstand (L-Base, supported on the knees)
description:
Description

Base

  • Place your hands on the shoulders and shoulder blades of the flyer.
  • Keep your arms straight.
  • Let your shoulders sink into the floor.

Flyer 

  • Lean againt the fingers of the base.
  • Straighten your arms.
  • Push with your hands against the thighs of the base.

Spotter 

  • Spot at the back of the flyer.
  • Stabilize the hips of the flyer to help them find the balance.

name: Back Bird
description:
Description

Base 

  • Place your feet on the bum of the flyer.
  • Your feet are slightly pointed.
  • Your toes reach until the lower back of the flyer.

Flyer 

  • Plank (hollow body, try to look at your feet).
  • Keep a tight body (engage the core and your legs).

Spotter 

  • Stand in the back or on the side.
  • Spot the head and the shoulders of the flyer.
fromSource: Foot to Hands on Bend Arms to Back Plank on Feet (L-Base) - Flyer bending
Foot to Hands on Bend Arms to Back Plank on Feet (L-Base) - Flyer rotating
Entry to Back Plank on Feet (L-Base) Handstand Entry
toTarget: Foot to Hands on Bend Arms

name: Back Bird (Belly Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Lie on your belly.
  • Balance the flyer on your feet.

Flyer 

  • Plank (hollow body, try to look at your feet).
  • Keep a tight body (engage the core and your legs).

Spotter 

  • Stand on the side.
  • Spot the head and the shoulders of the flyer.

name: Back Bird on Hands (L-Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Place your hands on the bum of the flyer.
  • Point your hands slightly up.
  • Your fingers reach until the lower back of the flyer.

Flyer 

  • Plank (hollow body, try to look at your feet).
  • Keep a tight body (engage the core and your legs).

Spotter 

  • Stand in the back or on the side.
  • Spot the head and the shoulders of the flyer.

name: Back Plank (Between Knees of Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Squeeze your legs together (most of the weight of the flyer is held by the squeezing).

Flyer 

  • Plank (hollow body, try to look at your feet).
  • Keep a tight body (engage the core and your legs).
  • Hold the feet of the base from the outside and balance yourself.

Spotter 

  • Stand in the back or on the side.
  • Spot the head and the shoulders of the flyer.

name: Reverse Flag
description:
Description

Base 

  • Stand stable with a straight back.

Flyer 

  • Keep most of your weight on the lower back of the base.
  • Hook your foot over the shoulder of the base to counterbalance.

Spotter 

  • Stand on the side.
  • Reach for the head and shoulders of the flyer.

name: Flag
description:
Description

Flag is a counterbalance where the base is standing in a chair position. The flyer has one foot hooked behind the neck and one foot is standing sideways on the thigh/knee of the base. Both base and flyer have a staight back and lean away from each other

Base 

  • Stand stable with a straight back.

Flyer 

  • Keep most of your weight on the legs of the base.
  • Hook your inside foot behind the neck of the base to come to the counterbalance.
  • Open your body to the side.

Spotter 

  • Stand at the back of the flyer.
  • Reach for the flyers head and shoulders.
contactPoint: Flyer on the knees of base

name: Flambeau
description:
Description


We need your help!

Looks like we're missing a description about that transition. Help out by sending a description: email!

name: Shoulderstand on Hands (L-Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Place your hands on the shoulders and shoulder blades of the flyer.

  • Keep your arms straight.
  • Let your shoulders sink into the floor.

Flyer 

  • Keep your body straight or slightly hollow.

  • Stay tight (engage the core and your legs).
  • Place your hands on the forearms of the base in the front, fingers point down.
  • Push your hands down on the forearms of the base to keep the balance.

Spotter 

  • Stand at the back of the flyer.

  • Spot the hips.

name: Reverse squatting on Knees
description:
Description

Base 

  • Lie on your back.
  • Bend your knees.
  • Keep your feet on the floor, hip width apart.
  • Keep tension in your legs.

Flyer 

  • Place your feet on the knees of the base.
  • Come to a squat.

Spotter 

  • Stand on the side.
  • Spot the shoulders and the head of the flyers (in case the legs of the base aren’t stable).
contactPoint: Flyer on the knees of base

name: Squatting on Knees
description:
Description

Base 

  • Lie on your back.
  • Bend your knees.
  • Keep your feet on the floor, hip width apart.
  • Keep tension in your legs.

Flyer 

  • Place your feet on the knees with your back to the base.
  • Come to a squat.

Spotter 

  • Stand on the side.
  • Spot the shoulders and the head of the flyers (in case the legs of the base aren’t stable).
contactPoint: Flyer on the knees of base

name: Reverse Standing on Thighs
description:
Description

Base 

  • Lean back with straight arms (this allows the flyer to lean forward and come into the counterbalance).

Flyer 

  • Place your feet parallel to the thighs of the base.
  • Keep a straight body (hips can come slightly forward).

Spotter 

  • Stay close to the hips of the flyer.
contactPoint: Flyer on the knees of base
toTarget: Sitting on Shoulders (Standing Base) with jump

name: Reverse Sitting on Feet
description:
Description

Base 

  • Place your feet on the bum of the flyer.
  • Flex your feet slightly to offer a nice platform.
  • Keep the legs of the flyer in a 90° angle (this means that you might need to bend your arms a bit).
  • Keep your hands exactly above your shoulders.
  • Let your shoulders sink into the floor.

Flyer 

  • Sit upright (stack your shoulders above your hips).
  • Keep your legs at a 90° angle.
  • Alternative: Place your feet on the frontside of the legs of the base (this will support your weight).

Spotter 

  • Stand at the back of the flyer.
  • Catch the flyer if necessary.
fromSource: Reverse Foot to Hand on Bent Arms (L-Base)
toTarget: Foot to Hand with half turn
Reverse Foot to Hand on Bent Arms (L-Base)
Foot to Hand with half turn

name: Reverse Supported Shoulderstand (L-Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Keep the weight of the flyer stacked on your hands and shoulders.
  • Let your shoulders sink into the floor and make your hands soft.
  • Keep your thumb close to your hand (this feels best for most bases).

Flyer 

  • Stay straight.
  • Keep a tight body (engage the core and your legs).
  • Hold the ankles of the base to support the balance.

Spotter 

  • Stand on the side or at the back of the flyer.
  • Spot the hips of the flyer.

name: Reverse Back Bird
description:
Description

Base 

  • Place your feet on the bum of the flyer.
  • Flex your feet (this prevents the flyer from falling backwards).

Flyer 

  • Plank (hollow body, try to look at your feet).
  • Keep a tight body (engage the core and your legs).

Spotter 

  • Stand on the side or at the back of the flyer.
  • Spot the head and the shoulders of the flyer.
fromSource: Reverse Standing in Hands on Bent Arms (L-Base)
toTarget: Reverse Standing in Hands on Bent Arms (L-Base)
Foot to hand (Sitting Base) with a pop

name: Handstand on Chair
description:
Description

Base 

  • Hold the shoulders of the flyer.
  • Lean back (this creates the counterbalance).

Flyer 

  • Place your hands on the thighs of the base.
  • Come to a handstand position.

Spotter 

  • Stand at the back of the flyer.
  • Spot the shoulders and the hips of the flyer.
  • Push the shoulders of the flyer back if the flyer closes the shoulders too much.
  • Bring the flyer safely to the floor by guiding/holding the hips.
contactPoint: Flyer on the knees of base

name: Reverse Handstand on Feet (L-Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Balance the handstand with small movements.

Flyer 

  • Place your hands on the middle part and heel of the feet.
  • Make a handstand with your back to the base.

Spotter 

  • Stand at the back of the flyer.
  • Spot mainly the shoulders of the flyer.
  • Push the shoulders back if the flyer is closing the shoulders too much.

name: Reverse Handstand on Hands (L-Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Turn your hands outward.
  • Keep your arms straight (the weight of the flyer should be stacked on your hands and shoulders).
  • Sink your shoulders into the floor.

Flyer 

  • Hold your handstand position.
  • The balance should be a little bit over the base’s head.

Spotter 

  • Spot the shoulders of the flyer.
  • Push the shoulders back if the flyer closes them too much.

name: Reverse Handstand on Hands (Standing Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Hold the flyer over your body (not too much in front of you).
  • Turn your hands out.
  • Push your elbows up.

Flyer 

  • Hold a handstand position.
  • Keep pressure in the hands.
  • The balance should be a little bit over the base.

Spotter 

  • Stand at the back of the base.
  • Keep your hands up and reach for the shoulders of the flyer.
  • Push the shoulders back, if the flyer closes them too much.

name: Reverse Bird
description:
Description

Reverse Plank on L-base is a common pose in a lot of washing machines where the flyer is lying with the hips on the L-base looking away from the base.

Base 

Hold your legs in a 90° angle or slightly towards your face.  This protects flyer from falling away. Flex your feet (this keeps the flyer from falling forward). Your feet are parallel to each other and on upper thighs, flyer’s hipbone one padding of foot. A common mistake is the foot is too high on the flyer’s stomach. Micro bend the knees to get your flyer in position. Once up, very slowly bring your legs into a 90 degree angle.

Flyer 

Keep your front body up, open your chest by pulling your shoulder blades together and keep your legs up (arch a bit, for some flyers it helps to look to the horizon). Do not hold your base’s hands, instead push off their calves if you need support. Tighten up your core. Relax your shoulders.

  • Be prepared to tilt to the side and bring your feet and hands down to brace for a fall

Spotting

The most likely crashes are that the flyers fall to the front or side away from base and the flyer stepping on the base’s torso or face .

  • Spot to the side of the flyer
  • Focus on the upper body and make sure you are close and underneath the flyer.

Prerequisites base

  • Solo pushups 5-10 times or tuck sit holds 5-10 seconds
  • Front plank pose
  • Assisted reverse bird (base pulls down on flyer’s ankles) presses 5-10 times

Prerequisites flyer

  • Superman/reverse situps on the ground and on yoga blocks 5-10 times
  • Regular plank on L-base unassisted 5-10 seconds
fromSource: Standing in Hands on Bent Arms (L-Base)
toTarget: Standing in Hands on Bent Arms (L-Base)

name: Folded Leaf
description:
Description

Base 

  • Hold your legs in a 90° angle to your upper body (ankles are exactly above your hips).
  • Place your feet as close as possible to the hips of the flyer (this makes it easier for the flyer).
  • Point your toes slightly out.

Flyer 

  • Pike your hips to about a 90° angle (bring your toes towards your ears).
  • Relax your upper body (let it hang down).

Spotter 

  • Stand behind the legs of the base.
  • Spot the hips of the flyer (both hands under the legs, so you can catch the flyer if the base collapses).

name: Maria on Hands (L-Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Flex your hands.
  • Keep your arms straight and balance the flyer.
  • Shoulders sink into the floor.

Flyer 

  • Keep your knee joint at a 90° angle.
  • Knees are hip width apart.
  • Keep a tight body (this makes it easier for the base to balance you).

Spotter 

  • Stand on the side.
  • Spot the upper body of the flyer.

name: Reverse Upper-Arm Stand (L-Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Flex your hands.
  • Keep your arms straight.
  • Place your fingers at the front of the flyers body, your thumb is on the back.
  • Balance your flyer.

Flyer 

  • Keep a tight body (hollow and engage your core).
  • Keep your arms straight.
  • Hold the arms/shoulders of the base (depending on the size difference).

Spotter 

  • Stand at the back of the flyer.
  • Spot the hips.

name: Reverse Shoulder Sit
description:
Description

Base 

  • Push the bum of the flyer up.

Flyer 

  • Lean a bit over the base (this way the weight is partly on the shoulders and hands of the base).

Spotter 

  • Spot at the side of the flyer.
  • Reach for the upper body.

name: Reverse Star
description:
Description

Base 

  • Hold your legs in a 90° angle to your upper body (ankles are exactly above your hips).
  • Balance the flyer.

Flyer 

  • Keep a straight and tight body (engage your core).
  • Hold the legs of the base at the calf muscles.
  • Fingers point down.
  • Keep your elbows in.
  • Push down with your hands to keep the balance.

Spotter 

  • Spot at the back of the flyer and prevent the flyer from falling over.

name: Standing on Feet (L-Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Hold your legs in a 90° angle to your upper body (ankles are exactly above your hips).
  • Keep your legs straight.
  • Point your feet a little bit.

Flyer 

  • Hold a straight and upright position. Tighten up your body.
  • Keep your legs hip width apart.
  • Relax your feet.
  • Look to the horizon (and smile).

Spotter 

  • Stand on the side.
  • Reach for the upper body of the flyer and stay close.
  • NOTE this balance is potentially dangerous as it can tilt very fast.

name: Reverse Foot to Hand
description:
Description

Base 

  • Rotate your hands outward
  • Keep your hands flat (don't push the ankles of the flyer in a 90° angle).

Flyer 

  • Hold a straight and upright position. Tighten up your body.
  • Keep your legs hip width apart.
  • Keep the angle in the ankle at around 90°.
  • Relax your feet.
  • Look to the horizon (and smile).

Spotter 

  • Stand on the side.
  • Reach for the upper body of the flyer.

name: Reverse Foot to Hand
description:
Description

Base 

  • Keep your elbows in and close to your chest.
  • Hold your hands close to your shoulders.
  • Turn your hands out.
  • Push your elbows up.
  • Try to keep your hands flat to offer a nice surface for the flyer to stand on.

Flyer 

  • Hold a straight and upright position. Tighten up your body.
  • Keep your legs hip width apart.
  • Keep the angle in the ankle at more than 90°
  • You may touch the shoulders of the base with your toes
  • Relax your feet.
  • Look to the horizon (and smile).

Spotter
toTarget: Foot to hand (Standing Base) (throwing the flyer)

name: Flag with Hand Support
description:
Description

Base:

  • With one hand hold the heel of the flyer, with the other hand take the top part of the foot
  • You can balance by moving the knee front and back over your feet.

Flyer

  • Stay straight and don't twist your body.
  • Flex foot to make it easier for the base to hold it

Spotter

  • Stand in the back of the flyer spotting the hips
  • If necesarry use also a spotter for the base.
contactPoint: Flyer on the knees of base

name: Hand Flag
description:
Description

Flyer

  • Keep your weight on the bases lower hand
  • It's basically a one arm handstand suppored by the second hand.
contactPoint: Flyer on the knees of base

name: Handstand on one Arm
description:
Description

Base:

  • Keep your hand on one height or only slightly higher than your elbow.
  • You can use your free arm to spot the outer shoulder of the flyer.

Flyer

  • Keep your weight on the arm that is close to the base
  • You can lean against the upper body of the base
  • It's basically a one arm handstand supported by the second hand.

Spotter

  • Spot the shoulders of the flyer

name: Handstand on one Knee
description:
Description


We need your help!

Looks like we're missing a description about that transition. Help out by sending a description: email!
contactPoint: Flyer on the knees of base

name: Handstand on Head (Standing Base)
description:
Description


We need your help!

Looks like we're missing a description about that transition. Help out by sending a description: email!

name: Reverse Handstand on Chair
description:
Description


We need your help!

Looks like we're missing a description about that transition. Help out by sending a description: email!
contactPoint: Flyer on the knees of base

name: Handstand on Feet (L-Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Point your feet (this way the flyer can have a nice hand grip).

Flyer 

  • Make your handstand position.
  • Hold a 45° angle in your wrists.
  • Open your shoulders to 180°, but do not arch your back
  • Don't balance.

Spotter 

  • Stand at the back of the flyer.
  • Spot the shoulders and the hips of the flyer.
  • Push the shoulders of the flyer back if the flyer closes the shoulders too much.
  • Bring the flyer safely to the floor by guiding/holding the hips or thighs.

name: Handstand on Feet (Belly Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Point your feet (this way the flyer can have a nice hand grip).

Flyer 

  • Make your handstand position.
  • Hold a 45° angle in your wrists.
  • Open your shoulders to 180°, but do not arch your back
  • Don't balance.

Spotter 

  • Stand at the back of the flyer.
  • Spot the shoulders and the hips of the flyer.
  • Push the shoulders of the flyer back if the flyer closes the shoulders too much.
  • Bring the flyer safely to the floor by guiding/holding the hips or thighs.

name: Handstand on Knees
description:
Description

Base 

  • Spot the shoulders of the flyer.
  • Help the flyer to find the balance.

Flyer 

  • Make your handstand position
  • Hold a 45° angle in your wrists.
  • Open your shoulders to 180°, but do not arch your back.
  • Don't control the balance.

Spotter 

  • Spot the hips of the flyer.
  • Bring the flyer safely to the floor by guiding/holding the hips or thighs.
contactPoint: Flyer on the knees of base

name: Handstand on Ankles
description:
Description

Base 

  • Push the shoulders of the flyer back if the flyer comes over too much.
  • Hold the shoulders of the flyer if necessary.
  • Help the flyer find the balance.

Flyer 

  • Place your hands on the ankles of the base.
  • Make your handstand position.
  • Try to keep the weight on the front part of the palm.

Spotter 

  • Stand on the side.
  • Spot the hips of the flyer.
  • Help the flyer to come down safely.

name: Handstand on Shins
description:
Description

Base 

  • Keep your knees at the same width as the shoulders of the flyer.
  • Lift your feet to offer a <90° angle platform for the flyer to make a handstand.
  • Balance the flyer by moving the legs, without changing the angle in your knee joint.

Flyer 

  • Make your handstand position.
  • Open your shoulders to 180°, but do not arch your back.
  • Don't control the balance.

Spotter 

  • Stand at the back of the flyer.
  • Spot the shoulders and the hips of the flyer.
  • Push the shoulders of the flyer back if the flyer closes the shoulders too much.
  • Bring the flyer safely to the floor by guiding/holding the hips or thighs.

name: Handstand on Shoulder (Standing Base)
description:
Description

Base 

Flyer 

  • Make your handstand position
  • Look to the back of the base.
  • Open your shoulders to 190° but take care that your back is not arched.
  • Don't control the balance.

Spotter 

  • Stand at the back of the flyer.
  • Spot the shoulders and the hips of the flyer.
  • Push the shoulders of the flyer back if the flyer closes the shoulders too much.
  • Bring the flyer safely to the floor by guiding/holding the hips or thighs.

name: Handstand on Head and Hand
description:
Description


We need your help!

Looks like we're missing a description about that transition. Help out by sending a description: email!

name: Handstand on Shoulder (Sitting Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Hold the shoulders of the flyer.

Flyer 

  • Make your handstand position.
  • Open your shoulders to 180° but take care that your back is not arched.
  • Don't control the balance.

Spotter 

  • Stand at the back of the flyer.
  • Spot the hips of the flyer.
  • Push the shoulders of the flyer back if the flyer closes the shoulders too much.
  • Bring the flyer safely to the floor by guiding/holding the hips or thighs.

name: Handstand on Hands (L-Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Hold a 45° angle in your wrists.
  • Keep your arms straight (the weight of the flyer should be stacked on your hands and shoulders).
  • Sink your shoulders into the floor.

Flyer 

  • Come to your handstand position.
  • Hold a 45° angle in your wrists.
  • Open your shoulders to 180°, but don’t arch your back.
  • Don’t balance.

Spotter 

  • Stand at the back of the flyer.
  • Spot the shoulders and the hips of the flyer.
  • Push the shoulders of the flyer back if the flyer closes the shoulders too much.
  • Bring the flyer safely to the floor by guiding/holding the hips or thighs.

name: Handstand on Hands (Belly Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Hold the weight of the flyer over your elbow
  • Hold a 45° angle in your wrists

Flyer 

  • Make your handstand position
  • Hold a 45° angle in your wrists.
  • Open your shoulders to 180°, but don't arch your back.
  • Don't balance.

Spotter 

  • Stand at the back of the flyer.
  • Spot the shoulders and the hips of the flyer.
  • Bring the flyer safely to the floor by guiding/holding the hips or thighs.

name: Handstand on Hands (Standing Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Tighten up your core and intend not to walk.
  • Your hands should be open.
  • Rotate your hands to the inside (this offers a nice platform for the flyer to make a handstand).
  • Hold a 45° angle in your wrists.

Flyer 

  • Make your handstand position
  • Hold a 45° angle in your wrists.
  • Open your shoulders to 180°, but don’t arch your back.
  • Don't control the balance.

Spotter 

  • Stand at the back of the flyer.
  • Spot the shoulders of the flyer.
  • Push the shoulders of the flyer back if the flyer closes the shoulders too much.
  • Bring the flyer safely to the floor by holding the shoulder and reaching/guiding the hips or thighs.
toTarget: Handstand on Extended Arms (Standing Base) with tempo

name: Handstand on Extended Arms (Standing Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Tighten up your core and intend not to walk.
  • Your hands should be open.
  • Rotate your hands to the inside (this offers a nice platform for the flyer to make a handstand).
  • Hold a 45° angle in your wrists.
  • Keep the arms/hands shoulder wide, elbows straight and shoulders close to your ears

Flyer 

  • Make your handstand position
  • Hold a 45° angle in the wrists.
  • Open your shoulders to 180°, but don’t arch your back.
  • Don't control the balance.
  • Keep the arms/hands shoulder wide.

Spotter 

  • Stand at the back of the flyer.
  • Spot the shoulders of the flyer.
  • Push the shoulders of the flyer back if the flyer closes the shoulders too much.
  • Bring the flyer safely to the floor by reaching/guiding the hips or thighs.

name: Bird
description:
Description

Base 

  • Place your feet on the hip bones of the flyer.

  • Keep your feet exactly above your hips.
  • Point your feet slightly.
  • Balance the flyer.

Flyer 

  • Keep your front body up and keep your legs up (arch a bit, for some flyers it helps to look to the horizon).

  • Tighten up your core.
  • Relax your shoulders.

Spotter 

  • Spot on the side.

  • Spot the upper body.
fromSource: Reverse Foot to Hand on Bent Arms (L-Base)
Throne on Feet (L-Base) to Plank on Feet (L-Base) Throne
toTarget: Handstand on Hands (L-Base) with half turn
Reverse Foot to Hand on Bent Arms (L-Base)

name: Plank on Chair
description:
Description

Base 

  • Hold arms/shoulders of flyer

Flyer 

  • Keep your front body up (arch a bit, for some flyers it helps to look to the horizon).
  • Tighten up your core.
  • Relax your shoulders.

Spotter
contactPoint: Flyer on the knees of base

name: Bird on Belly Base
description:
Description

Base 

  • Lie on your belly.
  • Balance the flyer on your feet.

Flyer 

  • Keep your front body up and keep your legs up (arch a bit, for some flyers it helps to look to the horizon).
  • Tighten up your core.
  • Relax your shoulders.

Spotter 

  • Spot at the side of the flyer.
  • Spot the upper body.

name: Bird on Hands
description:
Description

Base 

  • Place your hands on the hip bones of the flyer.
  • Point your hands slightly up.
  • Keep your arms straight above your shoulders.
  • Sink your shoulders into the floor.

Flyer 

  • Keep your front body up and keep your legs up (arch a bit, for some flyers it helps to look to the horizon).
  • Tighten up your core.
  • Relax your shoulders.

Spotter 

  • Stand on the side.
  • Spot the upper body of the flyer.

name: Plank on Shoulder
description:
Description

Base 

  • Stand upright and engage your core.

Flyer 

  • Keep your front body up and keep your legs up (arch a bit, for some flyers it helps to look to the horizon).
  • Tighten up your core.
  • Relax your shoulders.

Spotter 

  • Spott the head/shoulders of the flyer.

name: Plank between Knees
description:
Description


We need your help!

Looks like we're missing a description about that transition. Help out by sending a description: email!

name: High Reverse Bird
description:
Description

Base 

  • Keep the arms straight.
  • Try to open your shoulders to a 180° angle.
  • Keep your whole body stacked under the flyer.

Flyer 

  • Keep your front body up and keep your legs up (arch a bit, for some flyers it helps to look to the horizon).
  • Tighten up your core.
  • Relax your shoulders.

Spotter 

  • Stand in the front or on the side.
  • Spot the head and the shoulders of the flyer.

name: High Bird
description:
Description

Base 

  • Keep the arms straight.
  • Try to open your shoulders to a 180° angle.
  • Keep your whole body stacked under the flyer.

Flyer 

  • Keep your front body up and keep your legs up (arch a bit, for some flyers it helps to look to the horizon).
  • Tighten up your core.
  • Relax your shoulders.

Spotter 

  • Stand in the back or on the side.
  • Spot the head and the shoulders of the flyer.

name: Sit on One Arm (Standing Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Keep the arm straight.
  • Try to open your shoulder to a 180° angle.
  • Keep your whole body stacked under the flyer.
  • Push out the shoulder that holds the flyer

Flyer 

Spotter 

  • Stand in the back or on the side.
  • Spot the head and the shoulders of the flyer.

name: Sit on Two Arms (Standing Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Keep the arm straight.
  • Try to open your shoulder to a 180° angle.
  • Keep your whole body stacked under the flyer.

Flyer 

Spotter 

  • Stand in the back or on the side.
  • Spot the head and the shoulders of the flyer.

name: High Back Bird
description:
Description

Base 

  • Keep the arms straight.
  • Try to open your shoulders to a 180° angle.
  • Keep your whole body stacked under the flyer.

Flyer 

  • Plank (hollow body, try to look at your feet).
  • Keep a tight body (engage the core and your legs).

Spotter 

  • Stand in the back or on the side.
  • Spot the head and the shoulders of the flyer.

name: High Reverse Back Bird
description:
Description

Base 

  • Keep the arms straight.
  • Try to open your shoulders to a 180° angle.
  • Keep your whole body stacked under the flyer.

Flyer 

  • Plank (hollow body, try to look at your feet).
  • Keep a tight body (engage the core and your legs).
  • Look to the feet to maintain the hollow body position.

Spotter 

  • Stand in the front or on the side.
  • Spot the head and the shoulders of the flyer.

name: Foot to hand (Standing Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Tighten up your core and intend not to walk.
  • Your hands should be open.
  • Rotate your hands to the inside (this offers a nice platform for the flyer).
  • Hold a 45° angle in your wrists and give support to the heels of the flyer.

Flyer 

  • Hold a straight and upright position. Tighten up your body.
  • Keep your legs hip width apart.
  • Keep the angle in the ankle at more than 90°.
  • Relax your feet.

Spotter 

  • Stand in the back or on the side.
  • Spot the head and the shoulders of the flyer.
fromSource: Foot to Hand on Extended Arms
toTarget: Reverse Foot to Hand (throwing the flyer)
Foot to Hand on Extended Arms
Standing on Shoulders (Zombie) with a pop

name: Fish
description:
Description

Base:

  • Hold shoulder/arms of flyer

name: Straddle Bat
description:
Description

Base 

  • Hold your legs in a 90° angle to your upper body (ankles are exactly above your hips).
  • Place your feet as close as possible to the hips of the flyer (this makes it easier for the flyer).
  • Point your toes slightly out.

Flyer 

  • Pike your hips to about a 90° angle (bring your toes towards your ears).
  • Relax your upper body (let it hang down).

Spotter 

  • Spot at the back of the flyer.
  • Spot the hips of the flyer (both hands under the legs, so you can catch the flyer if the base collapses).

name: Maria on Hands (Standing Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Point your hands.
  • Keep your arms straight and balance the flyer.

Flyer 

  • Keep your knee joint at a 90° angle or slightly more.
  • Knees are hip width apart.
  • Keep a tight body (this makes it easier for the base to balance you).

name: Maria on Feet (L-Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Place your feet on the shins of the flyer, just below and slightly onto the knees.
  • Point your toes slightly.

Flyer 

  • Keep your knee joint at a 90° angle.
  • Knees are hip width apart.
  • Keep a tight body (this makes it easier for the base to balance you).

Spotter 

  • Stand on the side.
  • Spot the upper body of the flyer.

name: Reverse Maria on Hands (L-Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Point your hands slightly.
  • Keep your arms straight and balance the flyer.
  • Shoulders sink into the floor.

Flyer 

  • Keep your knee joint at a 90° angle.
  • Knees are hip width apart.
  • Keep a tight body (this makes it easier for the base to balance you).

Spotter 

  • Stand on the side.
  • Spot the upper body of the flyer.

toTarget: Foot to Hand on Extended Arms

name: Two-Man-High
description:
Description

Base 

  • Stand straight.
  • Tighten up your core.
  • Hold the calves of the flyer and pull them down (this makes the flyer feel safe and grounded).
  • Relax your shoulders to offer a nice platform.

Flyer 

  • Hold a straight and upright position.
  • Tighten up your body.
  • Keep your legs straight.
  • Turn your heels in and push against the bases head with your legs.
  • Relax your feet.

Spotter 

  • Stand in the back or on the side.
  • Reach for the legs of the flyer, or higher if you can reach.
  • Stay close.
  • If you are smaller/lighter than the flyer, make sure there's a second or even a third spotter.
toTarget: Sitting on Shoulders (Standing Base) stepping down

name: Shoulderstand on Chair
description:
Description


We need your help!

Looks like we're missing a description about that transition. Help out by sending a description: email!
contactPoint: Flyer on the knees of base

name: Star
description:
Description

Base 

  • Hold your legs in a 90° angle to your upper body (ankles are exactly above your hips).
  • Relax your feet.
  • Keep your arms up straight to support the flyer.
  • Sink your shoulders into the floor.

Flyer 

  • Keep a straight and tight body (engage your core).
  • Hold the hands of the base and keep some weight in the hands.
  • Relax your shoulders.

Spotter 

  • Stand at the back of the flyer.
  • Make sure the flyer doesn’t fall backwards.
toTarget: Standing in Hands (L-Base) Pike over to foot to hand

name: Shoulderstand on Feet (Belly Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Lie on your belly.
  • Balance the flyer on your feet.

Flyer 

  • Keep your body straight or slightly hollow.
  • Stay tight (engage the core and your legs).
  • Place your hands on the shins of the base, fingers point down.
  • Push your hands down on the shins of the base to keep the balance.

Spotter 

  • Stand at the back of the flyer.
  • Spot the hips.

name: Shoulderstand on Shins
description:
Description

Base 

Flyer 

  • Keep your body straight or slightly hollow.
  • Stay tight (engage the core and your legs).
  • Place your shoulders and hands on the shins of the base, fingers point down.
  • Push your hands down on the shins of the base to keep the balance.

Spotter 

  • Stand at the back of the flyer.
  • Spot the hips.

name: Standing on Shoulders (Sitting Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Sit up straight.
  • Tighten up your core.
  • Hold the calves of the flyer and pull them down (this makes the flyer feel safe and grounded).
  • Relax your shoulders to offer a nice platform.

Flyer 

  • Hold a straight and upright position.
  • Tighten up your body.
  • Keep your legs straight.
  • Turn your heels in and push against the bases head with your legs.
  • Relax your feet.

Spotter

name: Hanging Back Plank
description:
Description

Base 

Flyer 

  • Plank (hollow body, try to look at your feet).
  • Keep a tight body (engage the core and your legs).

Spotter

name: Hanging Plank
description:
Description

Base 

Flyer 

  • Keep your front body up and keep your legs up (arch a bit, for some flyers it helps to look to the horizon).
  • Tighten up your core.
  • Relax your shoulders.

Spotter

name: Sitting on Feet (Belly Base)
description:
Description


We need your help!

name: Standing on Head (Sitting Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • straddled legs or a "sitting-on-your-heels-position" is easier to keep, as a long-legs-sit.
  • try to have a really upright position with your upperbody (a lot of bases are leaning to much in front, which brings their head to much in the neck)

Flyer 

  • Hold a straight and upright position. Tighten up your body.
  • keep your bodyweight a little in front on your toes 
  • press your legs and feet together 
  • try actively to keep your position with your little feet-muscles (if your base is a little oldfashioned, don't tell him that you're doing this, but it helps him a lot...:-))

Spotter 

  • Stand in the back or a bit sideways of the flyer
  • hands touching the flyers hip!
  • look allways down to the head of the base. If he struggles, carry the flyer down immediately!
toTarget: Standing on Head (Standing Base) standing up

name: Foot to hand (Sitting Base)
description:

name: Standing on Hips
description:
Description

Flyer 

  • Hold a straight and upright position. Tighten up your body.
  • Keep your legs hip width apart.
  • Keep the angle in the ankle at around 90°
  • Relax your feet.
  • Look to the horizon (and smile).

name: Standing on Lower Back
description:
Description


We need your help!

Looks like we're missing a description about that transition. Help out by sending a description: email!

name: Standing on Head (Standing Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Hold a straight and upright position, tighten up your body, squeeze your butt. 
  • keep the back part of the head up and make a double-chin. 
  • frowning makes the skin of the head moving less. 
  • you want to feel the weight of the flyer in the front of your head and hold against it. 
  • if the weight gets to much communicate where you need it. 
  • If you have to move to balance the flyer, always move with the whole body not only with the head

Flyer 

  • Hold a straight and upright position. Tighten up your body.
  • keep your bodyweight a little in front on your toes 
  • press your legs and feet together 
  • try actively to keep your position with your little feet-muscles (if your base is a little oldfashioned, don't tell him that you're doing this, but it helps him a lot...:-))

Spotter 

  • Stand in the back of the flyer and reach out with your hands.
toTarget: Standing on Head (Sitting Base) sitting down

name: Reverse Standing on Feet (L-Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Hold your legs in a 90° angle to your upper body (ankles are exactly above your hips).
  • Keep your legs straight.
  • Put your heels up (flex).

Flyer 

  • Hold a straight and upright position. Tighten up your body.
  • Keep your legs hip width apart.
  • Keep the angle in the ankle at around 90°
  • Relax your feet.
  • Look to the horizon (and smile).

Spotter 

  • Stand on the side.
  • Reach for the upper body of the flyer and stay close.
  • NOTE this balance is potentially dangerous as it can tilt very fast.

name: Standing on Feet (Belly Base)
description:
Description

Base 

Flyer 

  • Hold a straight and upright position. Tighten up your body.
  • Keep your legs hip width apart.
  • Keep the angle in the ankle at around 90°
  • Relax your feet.
  • Look to the horizon (and smile).

Spotter 

  • Stand on the side.
  • Reach for the upper body of the flyer and stay close.

name: Foot to Shin
description:
Description

Base 

Flyer 

  • Hold a straight and upright position. Tighten up your body.
  • Keep your legs hip width apart.
  • Keep the angle in the ankle at more than 90°
  • Relax your feet.
  • Look to the horizon (and smile).

Spotter

name: Foot to Hand
description:
Description

Base 

  • Keep your hands at a slight angle.
  • Keep your arms straight above your shoulders.
  • Sink your shoulders into the floor.

Flyer 

  • Hold a straight and upright position. Tighten up your body.
  • Keep your legs hip width apart.
  • Relax your feet.
  • Look to the horizon (and smile).

Spotter 

  • Stand on the side.
  • Reach for the upper body of the flyer.
fromSource: Star to Standing in Hands (L-Base) Pike over
toTarget: Standing in Hands (Belly Base) Chinese Roll

name: Standing in Hands (Belly Base)
description:
Description

Base 

Flyer

  • Keep your legs hip width apart.
  • Relax your feet.
  • Look to the horizon (and smile).

Spotter 

  • Stand on the side.
  • Reach for the upper body of the flyer.

name: L-Sit (L-Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Keep your arms straight above your shoulders.
  • Point your hands slightly up (the angle depends on the preference of base and flyer).
  • Keep strong wrists.
  • Sink your shoulders into the floor.

Flyer 

  • Keep open hands (try not to squeeze).
  • Divide the weight equally over the palm of the hand (it helps to think of the weight going to the top of the palm).
  • Push from your shoulders, but keep them relaxed.
  • Try to push your bum up.

Spotter 

  • Stand on the side.
  • Keep your hands underneath the armpit of the flyer.
toTarget: Standing on Thighs with half turn

name: Reverse Straddle Sit on Feet (L-Base)
description:
Description

In reverse straddle sit the flyer sits on the feet of the base with the legs in straddle pike.

name: Bow on Feet (L-Base)
description:
Description

Bow is a L-basing pose where the flyer holds his/her feet in a arched position.

Base

  • Point your feet so that the flyer does not get the feeling to fall over to the front.

Flyer

  • Push the hips forward and try to make the bow from you chest and not from the lower back.
  • Try to extend the legs and push the knees together.

Spotter

  • Spot the pose from the side and be close to the shoulders of the flyer.

name: Foot to Hands on Bend Arms
description:
Description

Base 

  • Keep your hands at a slight angle.
  • Keep your hands straight above your ellbow.

Flyer 

  • Hold a straight and tighten up your body.
  • Keep your legs hip width apart.
  • Relax your feet.
  • Look to the horizon (and smile).

Spotter 

  • Stand on the side
  • Reach for the upper body of the flyer.
toTarget: Back Plank on Feet (L-Base) - Flyer bending to the front
Back Plank on Feet (L-Base) - Flyer rotating to the back

name: Foot to Hand - Box
description:
Description

Flyer:

  • Your hip should be above your feet and your feet above your base´s shoulders.
  • Keep your feet at an angle of about 45°.
  • Push down with your shoulders into the base´s feet to reduce your weight in the base´s hands.
  • Your shoulders should be above your hands which should be above the base´s hip.
  • Keep your hands and feet together so that you don´t push away the base´s hands or feet.

 

Base:

  • Hold your hands above your shoulders at an angle of about 45°.
  • You should support with your hand the ball of the foot as well as the heel.
  • Keep your feet above your hips at an angle of about 45° (if you don´t have enough flexibility to do that with extended legs you might also bend them a little but be aware that you should work on your hip flexibility because that helps a lot in many exercises).
  • Engage your core and your arms and legs to offer a strong platform for your flyer.

 

Spotting:

 

Stand at the sides of the flyer and spot the upper arms. Save the head of the flyers when legs  of the base tilt.
fromSource: Standing in Hands on Bent Arms (L-Base)
toTarget: Standing in Hands on Bent Arms (L-Base)

name: Reverse maria on Feet (L-Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Place your feet on the shins of the flyer, the heel just below and slightly onto the knees.
  • Flex your toes slightly.

Flyer 

  • Keep your knee joint at a 90° angle.
  • Knees are hip width apart.
  • Keep a tight body (this makes it easier for the base to balance you).

Spotter 

  • Stand on the side.
  • Spot the upper body of the flyer.

name: Floating Pashi
description:
Description

name: Shoulderstand (L-Base, hands on ankles)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Place your hands on the shoulders and shoulder blades of the flyer.
  • Keep your arms straight.
  • Let your shoulders sink into the floor.

Flyer 

  • Lean againt the fingers of the base.
  • Straighten your arms and stay tight.
  • Hold the ankles of the base to support the balance but don't balance activly with your budy

Spotter 

  • Spot at the back of the flyer.
  • Stabilize the hips of the flyer to help them find the balance.

name: Standing on Elbows
description:
Description

Bases keep the elbows a bit in front of the shoulder, the forearms  as parallel as possible and the hands a bit higher than the elbows.
That makes is possible for the flyer to stand on a small slope with feet hip-wide apart and the weight in the front part of the foot.

name: Reverse Foot to Hand on Bent Arms (L-Base)
description:
Description

Base 

  • Rotate your hands outward
  • Keep your hands flat (don't push the ankles of the flyer in a 90° angle).

Flyer 

  • Hold a straight and upright position. Tighten up your body.
  • Keep your legs hip width apart.
  • Keep the angle in the ankle at around 90°.
  • Relax your feet.
  • Look to the horizon (and smile).

Spotter 

  • Stand on the side.
  • Reach for the upper body of the flyer.

name: Needle
description:
Description

Base 

  • Place your hands on the shoulders and shoulder blades of the flyer.
  • Keep your arms straight.
  • Let your shoulders sink into the floor.

Flyer 

  • Keep your body straight or slightly hollow.
  • Stay tight (engage the core and your legs).

Spotter 

  • Stand at the back of the flyer.
  • Spot the hips.

name: Reverse Bow on Feet (L-Base)
description:
Description

Reverse Bow is a L-basing pose where the flyer holds his/her feet in a arched position.

Base

  • Point your feet so that the flyer does not get the feeling to fall over to the front.

Flyer

  • Push the hips forward and try to make the bow from you chest and not from the lower back.
  • Try to extend the legs and push the knees together.

Spotter

  • Spot the pose from the side and be close to the shoulders of the flyer.

fromSource: Foot to Hands on Bend Arms
toTarget: Foot to Hands on Bend Arms

name: Handstand on Elbows
description:
Description

Handstand on elbows is a good pre-exercise for Hand2Hand on L-Base. The elbow of the base is a lot more stable than the hands/wrists and that makes it easier to hold the handstand for the flyer.

Base:

Hold you hands slightly higher than the elbows to make a nice handstand platform for your flyer. Keep arms parallel to each other. Balance your flyer forth and back.

Flyer:

Stay in handstand position and hold your hollow body line.

Spotter:

Stand at the side of the flyer and spot the hips.

name: Biceps stand on Feet (L-Base)
description:
Description

Base

Hold your legs in a 90° angle to your upper body (ankles are slightly wider than your hips to accomodate for flyer's shoulders + biceps length). Balance the flyer.

Flyer

Keep a straight and tight body (engage your core). Body inclination is not vertical but roughly 10-20° backward. Biceps are resting on the soles of the base. Soles are locked by the elbows of the flyer. Circle the legs of the base and hold onto the shins. Fingers point down. Do not sink your shoulders towards the ground. Biceps should be horizontal. Head is facing to the belly of the flyer.

Spotter

Spot at the back of the flyer and prevent the flyer from falling over.
fromSource: Reverse Standing in Hands on Bent Arms (L-Base)

name: Croc on Feet (L-Base)
description:
Description

Base 

Place the foot in the elbow pit close to the upper arm of the flyer. Keep your foot above your hips.

Flyer 

Bring your elbow towards the belly, about halfway between your naval and the side of your body. This will support your body weight. Keep your front body up, straight and parallel to the ground. Tighten up your core and lift your legs. 

Spotter 

Spot on the side. Spot the upper body.
fromSource: Foot to Hands on Bend Arms
toTarget: Foot to Hands on Bend Arms

name: Croc on Hands (L-Base)
description:
Description

Base 

Place the hand in the elbow pit close to the upper arm of the flyer. Keep your hand above your shoulder. You can support the first hand with your second hand 

Flyer 

Bring your elbow towards the belly, about halfway between your naval and the side of your body. This will support your body weight. Keep your front body up, straight and parallel to the ground. Tighten up your core and lift your legs.

Spotter 

Spot on the side. Spot the upper body.

name: Side Bird on Hands (L-Base)
description:
Description

Base 

Place one hand on the thighs and one on the chest of the flyer. Keep your hands above your shoulders. Point your hands slightly.

Flyer 

Keep your upper body up and straight. Tighten up your core. Relax your shoulders. 

Spotter 

Spot on the side. Spot the upper body.

name: Side Bird on Feet (L-Base)
description:
Description

Base 

Place one foot on the thighs and one on the chest of the flyer. Keep your feet exactly above your hips. Point your feet slightly.

Flyer 

Keep your upper body up and straight. Tighten up your core. Relax your shoulders. 

Spotter 

Spot on the side. Spot the upper body.

name: Side Bird on Bent Legs (L-Base)
description:
Description

Base 

Place one foot on the thighs and one on the chest of the flyer. Bend your legs and keep your flexed feet over your chest.

Flyer 

Keep your upper body up and straight. Tighten your core. Relax your shoulders. 

Spotter 

Spot on the side. Spot the upper body.

name: Butterfly
description:
Description

Flyer needs to bring the lower leg really low and make sure that the upper leg does not twist to the back. The twisting leg will make the base rotate to compensate balance.

name: Cradle
description:
Description

Base holds the flyer with both arms, one in the back of the flyers upper body, one under the legs. The flyer holds one arm over the bases arm around the back.

name: Standing on Shoulders (Zombie)
description:
Description

The flyer stands on the horizontal and straight arms of the flyer. The flyer should keep more weight than usual on the heels so that is it easier to carry the weight for the base.
toTarget: Foot to hand (Standing Base) with a pop
Standing in Hands on Extended Arms (Standing Base)

name: V-Counterbalance
description:
Description

The flyer stands on the feet of the base. Bases and flyers legs and arms are extended.

name: Floating Pashi Sideways
description:
Description

Base

  • One foot is place on the side of the chest, with the toes close to the armpit and the heels on the ripbow.
  • The other foot is placed along the side of the leg.
  • Point both feet a bit so that the flyer does not get the feeling to fall to the headside.

Flyer

  • Hold your ankles and push the away.
  • Don't bend your upper body to the side.

name: Reverse Shoulderstand on Hands
description:
Description

Base 

  • Keep your arms straight.
  • Let your shoulders sink into the floor.

Flyer 

  • Keep your body straight or slightly hollow.

  • Stay tight (engage the core and your legs).
  • Place your hands on the forearms of the base in the back, fingers point down. It may be easiest to have your hands close to the bases wrists and your elbows slightly out.
  • Push your hands down on the forearms of the base to keep the balance.

Spotter 

  • Stand at the back of the flyer.

  • Spot the hips.
